speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: SCENE I. The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Enter QUINCE, SNUG, BOTTOM, FLUTE, SNOUT, and STARVELING

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Are we all met?

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Pat, pat; and here's a marvellous convenient place

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: for our rehearsal. This green plot shall be our

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: stage, this hawthorn-brake our tiring-house; and we

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: will do it in action as we will do it before the duke.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Peter Quince,--

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: What sayest thou, bully Bottom?

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: There are things in this comedy of Pyramus and

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Thisby that will never please. First, Pyramus must

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: draw a sword to kill himself; which the ladies

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: cannot abide. How answer you that?

speaker: SNOUT
text_entry: By'r lakin, a parlous fear.

speaker: STARVELING
text_entry: I believe we must leave the killing out, when all is done.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Not a whit: I have a device to make all well.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Write me a prologue; and let the prologue seem to

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: say, we will do no harm with our swords, and that

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Pyramus is not killed indeed; and, for the more

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: better assurance, tell them that I, Pyramus, am not

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Pyramus, but Bottom the weaver: this will put them

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: out of fear.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Well, we will have such a prologue; and it shall be

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: written in eight and six.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: No, make it two more; let it be written in eight and eight.

speaker: SNOUT
text_entry: Will not the ladies be afeard of the lion?

speaker: STARVELING
text_entry: I fear it, I promise you.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Masters, you ought to consider with yourselves: to

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: bring in--God shield us!--a lion among ladies, is a

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: most dreadful thing; for there is not a more fearful

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: wild-fowl than your lion living; and we ought to

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: look to 't.

speaker: SNOUT
text_entry: Therefore another prologue must tell he is not a lion.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Nay, you must name his name, and half his face must

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: be seen through the lion's neck: and he himself

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: must speak through, saying thus, or to the same

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: defect,--'Ladies,'--or 'Fair-ladies--I would wish

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: You,'--or 'I would request you,'--or 'I would

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: entreat you,--not to fear, not to tremble: my life

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: for yours. If you think I come hither as a lion, it

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: were pity of my life: no I am no such thing; I am a

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: man as other men are;' and there indeed let him name

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: his name, and tell them plainly he is Snug the joiner.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Well it shall be so. But there is two hard things;

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: that is, to bring the moonlight into a chamber; for,

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: you know, Pyramus and Thisby meet by moonlight.

speaker: SNOUT
text_entry: Doth the moon shine that night we play our play?

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: A calendar, a calendar! look in the almanac; find

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: out moonshine, find out moonshine.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Yes, it doth shine that night.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Why, then may you leave a casement of the great

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: chamber window, where we play, open, and the moon

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: may shine in at the casement.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Ay; or else one must come in with a bush of thorns

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: and a lanthorn, and say he comes to disfigure, or to

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: present, the person of Moonshine. Then, there is

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: another thing: we must have a wall in the great

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: chamber; for Pyramus and Thisby says the story, did

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: talk through the chink of a wall.

speaker: SNOUT
text_entry: You can never bring in a wall. What say you, Bottom?

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Some man or other must present Wall: and let him

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: have some plaster, or some loam, or some rough-cast

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: about him, to signify wall; and let him hold his

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: fingers thus, and through that cranny shall Pyramus

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: and Thisby whisper.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: If that may be, then all is well. Come, sit  down,

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: every mother's son, and rehearse your parts.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Pyramus, you begin: when you have spoken your

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: speech, enter into that brake: and so every one

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: according to his cue.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Enter PUCK behind

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: What hempen home-spuns have we swaggering here,

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: So near the cradle of the fairy queen?

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: What, a play toward! I'll be an auditor;

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: An actor too, perhaps, if I see cause.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Speak, Pyramus. Thisby, stand forth.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Thisby, the flowers of odious savours sweet,--

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Odours, odours.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: --odours savours sweet:

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: So hath thy breath, my dearest Thisby dear.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: But hark, a voice! stay thou but here awhile,

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: And by and by I will to thee appear.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: A stranger Pyramus than e'er played here.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: Must I speak now?

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Ay, marry, must you; for you must understand he goes

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: but to see a noise that he heard, and is to come again.

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: Most radiant Pyramus, most lily-white of hue,

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: Of colour like the red rose on triumphant brier,

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: Most brisky juvenal and eke most lovely Jew,

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: As true as truest horse that yet would never tire,

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: I'll meet thee, Pyramus, at Ninny's tomb.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: 'Ninus' tomb,' man: why, you must not speak that

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: yet; that you answer to Pyramus: you speak all your

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: part at once, cues and all Pyramus enter: your cue

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: is past; it is, 'never tire.'

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: O,--As true as truest horse, that yet would

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: never tire.

speaker: FLUTE
text_entry: Re-enter PUCK, and BOTTOM with an ass's head

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: If I were fair, Thisby, I were only thine.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: O monstrous! O strange! we are haunted. Pray,

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: masters! fly, masters! Help!

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Exeunt QUINCE, SNUG, FLUTE, SNOUT, and STARVELING

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: I'll follow you, I'll lead you about a round,

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Through bog, through bush, through brake, through brier:

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Sometime a horse I'll be, sometime a hound,

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: A hog, a headless bear, sometime a fire;

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: And neigh, and bark, and grunt, and roar, and burn,

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Like horse, hound, hog, bear, fire, at every turn.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Why do they run away? this is a knavery of them to

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: make me afeard.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Re-enter SNOUT

speaker: SNOUT
text_entry: O Bottom, thou art changed! what do I see on thee?

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: What do you see? you see an asshead of your own, do

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: you?

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Exit SNOUT

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Re-enter QUINCE

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Bless thee, Bottom! bless thee! thou art

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: translated.

speaker: QUINCE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: I see their knavery: this is to make an ass of me;

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: to fright me, if they could. But I will not stir

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: from this place, do what they can: I will walk up

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: and down here, and I will sing, that they shall hear

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: I am not afraid.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Sings

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: The ousel cock so black of hue,

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: With orange-tawny bill,

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: The throstle with his note so true,

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: The wren with little quill,--

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: [Awaking]  What angel wakes me from my flowery bed?

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: The finch, the sparrow and the lark,

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: The plain-song cuckoo gray,

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Whose note full many a man doth mark,

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: And dares not answer nay;--

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: for, indeed, who would set his wit to so foolish

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: a bird? who would give a bird the lie, though he cry

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: 'cuckoo' never so?

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: I pray thee, gentle mortal, sing again:

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Mine ear is much enamour'd of thy note;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: So is mine eye enthralled to thy shape;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And thy fair virtue's force perforce doth move me

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: On the first view to say, to swear, I love thee.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Methinks, mistress, you should have little reason

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: for that: and yet, to say the truth, reason and

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: love keep little company together now-a-days; the

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: more the pity that some honest neighbours will not

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: make them friends. Nay, I can gleek upon occasion.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Thou art as wise as thou art beautiful.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Not so, neither: but if I had wit enough to get out

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: of this wood, I have enough to serve mine own turn.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Out of this wood do not desire to go:

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Thou shalt remain here, whether thou wilt or no.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: I am a spirit of no common rate;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: The summer still doth tend upon my state;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And I do love thee: therefore, go with me;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: I'll give thee fairies to attend on thee,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And they shall fetch thee jewels from the deep,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And sing while thou on pressed flowers dost sleep;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And I will purge thy mortal grossness so

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: That thou shalt like an airy spirit go.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Peaseblossom! Cobweb! Moth! and Mustardseed!

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Enter PEASEBLOSSOM, COBWEB, MOTH, and MUSTARDSEED

speaker: PEASEBLOSSOM
text_entry: Ready.

speaker: COBWEB
text_entry: And I.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: And I.

speaker: MUSTARDSEED
text_entry: And I.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Where shall we go?

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Be kind and courteous to this gentleman;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Hop in his walks and gambol in his eyes;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Feed him with apricocks and dewberries,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: With purple grapes, green figs, and mulberries;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: The honey-bags steal from the humble-bees,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And for night-tapers crop their waxen thighs

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And light them at the fiery glow-worm's eyes,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: To have my love to bed and to arise;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And pluck the wings from Painted butterflies

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: To fan the moonbeams from his sleeping eyes:

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Nod to him, elves, and do him courtesies.

speaker: PEASEBLOSSOM
text_entry: Hail, mortal!

speaker: COBWEB
text_entry: Hail!

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Hail!

speaker: MUSTARDSEED
text_entry: Hail!

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: I cry your worship's mercy, heartily: I beseech your

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: worship's name.

speaker: COBWEB
text_entry: Cobweb.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: I shall desire you of more acquaintance, good Master

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Cobweb: if I cut my finger, I shall make bold with

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: you. Your name, honest gentleman?

speaker: PEASEBLOSSOM
text_entry: Peaseblossom.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: I pray you, commend me to Mistress Squash, your

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: mother, and to Master Peascod, your father. Good

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Master Peaseblossom, I shall desire you of more

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: acquaintance too. Your name, I beseech you, sir?

speaker: MUSTARDSEED
text_entry: Mustardseed.

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Good Master Mustardseed, I know your patience well:

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: that same cowardly, giant-like ox-beef hath

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: devoured many a gentleman of your house: I promise

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: you your kindred had made my eyes water ere now. I

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: desire your more acquaintance, good Master

speaker: BOTTOM
text_entry: Mustardseed.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Come, wait upon him; lead him to my bower.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: The moon methinks looks with a watery eye;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: And when she weeps, weeps every little flower,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Lamenting some enforced chastity.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Tie up my love's tongue bring him silently.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Exeunt
